meanings.sent1: Her prudishness made her uncomfortable discussing anything related to intimacy.
meanings.sent2: His prudishness was evident when he blushed at the mere mention of a romantic scene in the movie.
meanings.sent3: Despite her prudishness, she couldn't help but giggle at the awkwardness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The prudishness of the small town was like a thick fog, enveloping any hint of impropriety.
meanings.sent5: The prudishness of the old librarian was legendary, with even romance novels hidden away from public view.

meanings.definition: Behavior or attitudes that are excessively modest or proper
meanings.sent1: His prudishness extended to never wearing anything revealing, even in the scorching heat.
meanings.sent2: The prudishness of the Victorian era is often depicted in literature with characters following strict social norms.
meanings.sent3: The prudishness of the cat wearing a bowtie to a casual gathering amused everyone present.
meanings.sent4: Her prudishness was like a shield, protecting her from any hint of impropriety in her behavior.
meanings.sent5: The prudishness of the old-fashioned gentleman was so extreme that he refused to even shake hands with a lady.
